DOC.brief_summary: Intrapartum epidural analgesia associate adverse breastfeeding outcome . One potential mechanism involve transfer epidural fentanyl across placenta neonatal blood-brain barrier , subsequently attenuate neonatal exhibition feeding behavior , latch swallowing , immediate postpartum period . Vigorous feed behavior first day life significant predictor long-term breastfeeding success 3 6 month . In randomized , control , double-blinded study , neonatal Neurologic Adaptive Capacity Scores ( NACS ) significantly low mother receive > 150 mcg epidural fentanyl versus bupivacaine-only analgesia , mean umbilical cord fentanyl concentration significantly high > 150 mcg versus < 150 mcg group . The investigator hypothesize epidural fentanyl-bupivacaine analgesia significantly associate decreased breastfeeding rate hospital discharge neonatal deficit latch onto breast swallowing first three hour life , significant dose-response relationship exist respect total microgram fentanyl infuse . The investigator perform prospective cohort study parturients age 18+ UHCMC three-month period , exclude multiple gestation , Cesarean section , neonatal intensive care unit admission . From patient chart , investigator record follow variable : number neonate deliver ; type delivery ( spontaneous vaginal / operative vaginal / Cesarean section ) ; whether neonate admit intensive care unit ; mother 's age , height , weight , gravity , parity , intention breast-feed time hospital admission , number child previously breast-fed , ethnicity ; gestational age time delivery ; administration oxytocin labor augmentation quantity ; duration active labor ; antibiotic administration ; neonatal APGAR score 1 5 minute postpartum ; whether opioids antibiotic administer and/or delivery exact time . We also record whether patient receive epidural labor , , duration epidural infusion total microgram fentanyl deliver ; neonatal feeding behavior quantify LATCH score assign breast-feeding interaction occur postpartum care floor ; whether mother breast-feeding baby time discharge hospital , , primary reason ( communicate standard postpartum lactation consultation ) ; long mother baby stay hospital post-delivery .
DOC.brief_title: Intrapartum Epidural Fentanyl Breast-feeding Immediate Postpartum Period : Prospective Cohort Study
DOC.criteria: age 18 multiple gestation Cesarean section neonatal intensive care unit admission
